page.title: 14THE NEW WARMINSTER LIBRARY
page.content: The old town Library was too small to cope with demand, so a new Library, designed by County Council architect John Hazel, was built in 1981-2 at a cost of Â£630,000. It is sited in the central car park and near Safeways supermarket for ease of access. The new library is well stocked with about 44,000 books and 15,000 tapes, as well as periodicals, maps, slides and even special tapes for the handicapped. It has become much more popular than the old building - there are now 13,300 library members. Busy local Librarian, Mr Michael Marshman, heading 11 full and part-time staff, says running a modern library is a complex job: it requires several years training including a specialist degree. Despite using computers and new technology, Mr Marshman thinks the future of the Library Service still lies in books.
